author: PA Media
description: The owners of Paddington Bear want a “frightening” puppet used on the show Spitting Image delivered to them or destroyed, according to court documents. StudioCanal, which makes the Paddington films, and Paddington and Company are bringing legal action against Avalon, producer of the puppet-based satirical series, at the High Court in London. Spitting Image made […]
title: Paddington Owners Want Spitting Image Puppet Given Over or Destroyed, Court Told

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: NSW MP Rod Roberts, who has accused his former party of fraud, has advised the equivocating Nationals MP not to jump to One Nation.
title: Former One Nation MP Warns Barnaby Joyce ‘It’ll End in Tears’

author: Catherine Yang
description: President announced stops in Malaysia, Japan, and South Korea, starting on Oct. 26.
title: Trump Set to Embark on Asia Tour: What to Know

author: Olivia Gomm
description: British Columbia is proposing changes to its electricity rules that would prioritize certain industries while others would have to bid for access to a set amount of power. B.C. Energy Minister Adrian Dix tabled legislation on Oct. 20 that would prioritize the province’s electricity supply for natural resource projects, like mining, upstream natural gas, and […]
title: BC Tables New Electricity Rules for AI, Data Centres, Hydrogen Exports

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Police Commemoration Day, ‘Rose Garden Club’ Lunch, Nicolas Sarkozy Goes to Prison

author: Ryan Morgan
description: The U.S. president described hardening international opposition toward Hamas amid challenges to an ongoing Gaza cease-fire.
title: Trump Says He’s Urged Restraint From Countries Offering to ‘Straighten Out Hamas’

author: Travis Gillmore
description: Americans will help staff the new command center, while other nations could supply troops to assist with peacekeeping efforts.
title: Vance Announces Civilian Military Cooperation Center, Vows No US Troops in Gaza

author: Chandra Philip
description: General Motors (GM) is ending production of its BrightDrop electric delivery van at the CAMI plant in Ingersoll, Ont., citing insufficient demand for the vehicle. An Oct. 21 statement from the company said it has no plans to move production to another location, noting that the commercial electric delivery van market “developed much slower than […]
title: GM Ending Production of Electric Van at CAMI Plant in Ontario

author: Frank Fang
description: 'Attempts at intimidation will not stop the United States from rebuilding its shipbuilding base,' Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said.
title: US Trade Chief Warns China Against Retaliation on Companies Aiding American Industry

author: Michael Zwaagstra
description: Commentary Reading skills are on the decline among students in British Columbia. For example, according to data from the Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA), from 2012 to 2022 (the latest year of available data), reading scores among B.C. students declined by 24 points. The OECD considers 20 points to be the approximate equivalent of […]
title: Michael Zwaagstra: Screening Tools Alone Won’t Improve Reading Skills of BC Students

author: Peter Best
description: Commentary The worst thing that can happen to a property owner isn’t a flood or a leaky foundation. It’s learning that you don’t own your property—that an aboriginal band does. This summer’s Cowichan Tribes v. Canada decision presented property owners in Richmond, B.C., with exactly that horrible reality, awarding aboriginal title to numerous properties, private […]
title: Judges Are Remaking Constitutional Law, Not Applying It—and Canadians’ Property Rights Are Part of the Collateral Damage

author: Jackson Richman
description: Last month, the United States attacked a Colombian boat allegedly carrying drugs.
title: Colombia’s President Suggests Getting ‘Rid of’ Trump

author: Noé Chartier
description: A crucial vote of confidence in the minority Liberal government over its budget will take place in the coming weeks, and Minister Steven MacKinnon said he is concerned with the current state of affairs. “When I see opposition parties play political games in a cavalier fashion with the future of the country, with our budget, […]
title: Minister MacKinnon ‘Worried’ About Opposition Parties’ Stance on Budget

author: Chandra Philip
description: Researchers have solved the nearly 50-year-old mystery of Toronto’s “Subway Deer,” a fossil that was discovered in the 1970s during construction of the city’s subway. A partnership between Trent University, the Royal Ontario Museum, and the Royal Alberta Museum helped discover the antler fossil dates back more than 11,000 years. The fossil consists of a […]
title: Ontario Researchers Solve Nearly 50-Year-Old Mystery of Toronto’s ‘Subway Deer’ Fossil

author: The Canadian Press
description: Germany’s defence minister says the German firm bidding for Canada’s lucrative submarine contract would have no trouble doing the work on time and on budget. Defence ministers from Germany and Norway are in Ottawa this week for meetings with Canadian ministers as the federal government shops around for a contractor to build a new fleet […]
title: Germany, Norway on Charm Offensive in Ottawa as Canada Shops for New Subs

author: Epoch Video
description: Japan’s new Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi holds a news conference on Oct. 21 in Tokyo, after being formally confirmed as the country’s new leader in a parliamentary vote earlier in the day.
title: REPLAY: Japan’s New Prime Minister Holds News Conference

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Canada-U.S. Trade Minister Dominic LeBlanc says it’s “over-optimistic” to expect a trade deal with the United States in the coming days, noting Canada is making progress but still has work to do to secure a deal. The minister told reporters on Oct. 21 that while he’s optimistic by nature, he was “surprised” to see media […]
title: Minister LeBlanc Says It’s ‘Over-Optimistic’ to Expect Trade Deal With US in Coming Days

author: Rachel Roberts
description: The 70-year-old maintains his innocence after being found guilty of corruption charges, but a judge ruled he could only appeal once behind bars.
title: Former French President Nicholas Sarkozy Enters Paris Prison to Begin Sentence

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Critics say the EU should have paused implementation to allow time for a thorough overhaul of the regulation.
title: European Commission Proposes Easing of Deforestation Law Burden for Small Firms

author: The Canadian Press
description: Maintenance employees with Montreal’s public transit agency are going on strike for the month of November, their third walkout since June. The union representing the 2,400 employees says the strike will begin on Halloween night and continue until Nov. 28. Employees will refuse to work overtime, and bus and metro service will be interrupted occasionally […]
title: Montreal Transit Maintenance Workers Announce Third Strike, Spanning Most of November

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre says his allegations of political interference by the RCMP during former Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s terms in office were aimed at the former commissioner of the federal service, not the entire police force. Poilievre’s spokesperson issued a written statement to the media on Oct. 20, in which the Tory leader said […]
title: Poilievre Says RCMP Remarks Were Aimed at Former Commissioner

author: Rachel Roberts
description: George Abaraonye once debated Kirk at the prestigious union but lost a vote of confidence following a leaked Whatsapp message and an Instagram post.
title: Oxford Union President-Elect Who Celebrated Charlie Kirk Shooting Ousted

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) is struggling to recruit enough members to meet its operational requirements and does not have enough adequate housing for its members, according to two new reports by Canada’s Auditor General Karen Hogan. Hogan’s Oct. 21 report said that on average, the CAF successfully recruited around one in every 13 applicants […]
title: Canadian Armed Forces Struggles With Recruitment, Housing Accommodations: Auditor General

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Longer education paths, unstable employment, and housing challenges are keeping many Italians from starting families.
title: Italy Faces Further Drop in Births Amid Record-Low Fertility, National Statistics Bureau Says

author: Guy Birchall
description: Juraj Cintula, 72, was found guilty of terrorism charges.
title: Man Who Shot Slovak Prime Minister Sentenced to 21 Years in Prison

author: PA Media
description: Downing Street has signalled it still sees hope for Maccabi Tel Aviv fans to attend next month’s Europa League clash with Aston Villa despite the Israeli side saying it would not accept tickets for its fans. The Israeli club’s announcement on Monday night came amid efforts by ministers to overturn a ban on fans from […]
title: Talks to Provide Extra Policing for Maccabi Match Against Villa Continue – No 10

author: PA Media
description: Heavy downpours and winds of up to 75mph are set to batter the UK this week, forecasters said as three weather warnings were issued. On Thursday, the wet and windy conditions may cause travel disruption, flooding, power cuts and damage to buildings within the alert areas, according to the Met Office. A yellow weather warning […]
title: Heavy Downpours and Winds of up to 75Mph Forecast as Warnings Issued

author: PA Media
description: Communities will welcome a focus on “actual hate crime”, the justice minister said after Britain’s biggest force indicated it would stop policing “toxic culture war debates”. Sarah Sackman described the move by the Metropolitan Police to stop investigating non-crime hate incidents as “welcome news”. The Met’s announcement came as it emerged Father Ted creator Graham […]
title: Communities Will Welcome Focus on ‘Actual Hate Crime’, Says Justice Minister

author: PA Media
description: Thames Water has agreed to delay a possible appeal over how much it can charge for customer bills while talks over a refinancing deal with potential buyers take place. The UK’s biggest water firm said it had agreed with Ofwat to defer the case until further notice. It had previously asked the water watchdog to refer its […]
title: Thames Water Delays Challenging Watchdog’s Ruling on Bills Amid Rescue Plan

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Canada Revenue Agency’s contact centres are not providing callers with timely and accurate information about taxes and benefits, the auditor general says. Auditor General Karen Hogan tabled six reports in the House of Commons on Oct. 21, including one specifically on the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA). It says that while the agency’s standard is […]
title: Auditor General Finds CRA Not Providing Timely, Accurate Information to Callers

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: In a bid to break Bejing's grip on critical minerals President Trump and Prime Minister Albanese announced they are investing in Australian miners.
title: Why Gallium Matters: Inside the $3 Billion US–Australia Bid to Outpace China

author: Reuters
description: OTTAWA—Canada’s annual inflation rate increased to 2.4 percent in September mainly led by a smaller decline in gasoline prices on a yearly basis when compared with the previous month and rise in food prices, data showed on Tuesday. This is the most crucial data point to be released before the Bank of Canada meets for […]
title: Canada’s Annual Inflation Rate Rises to 2.4% in September

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Senior U.S. officials arrived in Israel to continue work on a lasting cease-fire.
title: Israel Confirms Body of IDF Soldier Returned

author: Guy Birchall
description: Trump said that Ukraine should cede territory in the Donbas region already under Russian control in order to end the war.
title: European Countries Back Trump’s Call for Cease-Fire on Current Lines in Ukraine

author: Jarvis Lim
description: Beijing's dominance in rare earth processing and magnet production leaves Europe vulnerable to supply disruptions in key industries.
title: China’s Rare Earth Curbs Threaten Europe’s Defense, Economy: Experts

description: The move has been likened to 'The Voice' proposal.
title: Queensland LNP Strikes Indigenous Councils Accord, Promises Direct Access to Ministers

description: Daniel Suidani, a former provincial premier in the Solomon Islands, strenuously opposed his homeland's increasing ties to the CCP.

description: 'As the power of the PLA and its capabilities expands, it is conducting more and more operations beyond its territorial areas,' said the defence secretary.

description: President Trump affirms his commitment to AUKUS but says American strength is enough to ensure Indo-Pacific stability.

description: Takaichi replaces Shigeru Ishiba, who resigned with his Cabinet earlier in the day.

description: John Lyons says the prime minister's office did not approve access.

description: The two leaders signed a landmark critical minerals and rare earths framework on Oct. 20.
title: Australian Rare Earths Shares Surge Following Trump-Albanese Critical Minerals Deal

author: Reuters
description: WARSAW—American pianist Eric Lu won the top prize at the prestigious International Chopin Piano Competition in Warsaw on Tuesday. The decision came after hours of deliberations by a 17-person international jury, chaired by American pianist Garrick Ohlsson. The winner of the 19th edition of the competition receives a 60,000 euro ($69,972) prize and a gold […]
title: American Eric Lu Crowned Winner of Chopin Piano Competition

author: Omid Ghoreishi
description: Polls have closed in Alberta’s municipal elections, and vote counting has begun to determine the winners of mayoral, council, and school board trustee races. Voters in Edmonton are deciding on a new mayor, with incumbent Amarjeet Sohi, a former cabinet minister under Justin Trudeau’s Liberal government who took a temporary leave of absence to make […]
title: Polls Close in Edmonton, Calgary Mayoral Elections

author: The Associated Press
description: TORONTO—George Springer put Toronto ahead with a three-run homer in the seventh inning and the Toronto Blue Jays advanced to the World Series for the first time since 1993 by beating the Seattle Mariners 4-3 in Game 7 of the American League Championship Series on Monday night. It was the first go-ahead homer in Game […]
title: Blue Jays to Play in First World Series Since 1993 After Beating Mariners

author: Michael Zhuang
description: The CCP's Fourth Plenum has been overshadowed by purge of generals and admirals allied with party leader Xi Jinping.
title: Purge of China’s Top Military Leaders Exposes Deep Crisis in Xi’s Command, Experts Say

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: CBC President Marie-Philippe Bouchard defended her network against accusations of bias and toxic workplace culture, saying the network is “striving to be balanced” and that most staff have a “widely positive” experience in working for the publicly funded broadcaster. Bouchard’s comments came Oct. 20 as she testified before the parliamentary Standing Committee on Canadian Heritage […]
title: CBC Chief Defends Workplace Culture, News Balance in Testimony Before MPs

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The latest incident continues a series of intimidatory actions by the CCP against Australia.
title: Wong Condemns ‘Unsafe and Unprofessional’ Chinese Jet Flare Action

author: Monica O’Shea
description: Trump and Albanese had a positive meeting overall.
title: Opposition Calls for Rudd to Be Recalled Following Exchange With Trump

description: The deal will see the US and Australia invest in critical mineral processing facilities to wrest control of the industry from China.
title: Wong Hails US Mineral Deal, Stands by ‘Calm, Mature’ Diplomacy

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Housing Minister Gregor Robertson says the average price of homes in Canada needs to fall to restore affordability, as he faced questions from the Opposition about his earlier remarks that property values should be maintained. Robertson appeared before the House of Commons finance committee on Oct. 20 to answer questions from MPs about his government’s […]
title: Minister Says Home Prices Must Fall to Restore Affordability After Opposition Questions Earlier Remarks
